title: Bailee Zacovic
text: Here are a few pieces of my calligraphy, all featuring mathematical quotes. I am always looking for new inspiration; feel free to reach out!

title: Bailee Zacovic
text:
Hi! My name is Bailee. I am a second-year Ph.D. student at the University of Michigan, Ann Arbor, working with Thomas Lam.
I completed my bachelor’s degree in Mathematics and Philosophy at the University of Notre Dame, and spent a year in the Mathematics Master’s Program at the University of Bonn in Germany.
Broadly, I am interested in algebraic combinatorics and its interactions with particle physics. I am currently thinking about positive geometries and the combinatorics of scattering amplitudes.
I am grateful for the support of the NSF Graduate Research Fellowship.
Office: 4867 East Hall Email: bzacovic[at]umich[dot]edu

title: Bailee Zacovic
text:
Peer reviewed journal publications

B. Zacovic, J. Koefler, U. Oktem, S. Paranjape, and J. Trnka, “Uniqueness of MHV Gravity Amplitudes.” Le Matematiche, Vol. 80 No. 1 (2025) https://lematematiche.dmi.unict.it/index.php/lematematiche/article/view/2743.
B. Zacovic, M. Cho, A. Dochtermann, R. Inagaki, S. Oh, and D. Snustad, “Chip-Firing and Critical Groups of Signed Graphs.” SIAM Journal on Discrete Mathematics, Vol. 39, Iss. 2 (2025) https://epubs.siam.org/doi/abs/10.1137/24M1655287?journalCode=sjdmec.
B. Zacovic, D. Galvin, and G. Wesley, “Enumerating Threshold Graphs and Some Related GraphClasses.” Journal of Integer Sequences, Vol. 25. (2022) https://cs.uwaterloo.ca/journals/JIS/VOL25/Galvin/galvin2.pdf.

title: Bailee Zacovic
text:
Directed Reading Program Mentorship
I served as a project mentor for the Spelman-Morehouse Directed Reading Program (DRP) in the Spring of 2025. I worked with Sydni Jackson on the project “Symmetric functions: their combinatorics and applications,” and we used this wonderful text by Eric S. Egge.

title: Bailee Zacovic
text:
Equity-focused teaching
I am passionate about cultivating mathematical enchantment in K-12 classrooms (and beyond) through inquiry-based pedagogy, and commited to equity-focused teaching practices and inclusive excellence. I am currently working toward the U-M Graduate Teacher Certificate.

title: Bailee Zacovic
text:
Association for Women in Mathematics (AWM)
I manage the website of the University of Michigan’s Association for Women in Mathematics (AWM). Check out our events and activities!

title: Bailee Zacovic
text:
Art of Problem Solving (AoPS Online)
Since July 2021, I have served as a grader for the online math community Art of Problem Solving. In this role, I provide guidance, mentorship, and personalized feedback on written homework to students of rigorous math courses to sharpen proof-writing and stimulate critical thinking.
